thread.title_full: Strictly Come Dancing: Peter Andre responds to James Jordan's 'favouritism' suggestions - Strictly Come Dancing News - Reality TV - Digital Spy

author: Amy Davidson
title: Strictly Come Dancing: Peter Andre responds to James Jordan's 'favouritism' suggestions - Strictly Come Dancing Reality TV -
text: Peter Andre has shrugged off James Jordan's suggestions that Strictly bosses might be favouring him.In a series of tweets critiquing Andre's performance over the weekend, the former pro brought the positioning of the singer's performances into question. © BBC / Strictly Come Dancing Strictly Come Dancing 2015 winner: We rank the celebrities' chances of topping BBC One's dance-off"I love Peter but I wonder if he will open or close every show? Fairness," Jordan wrote.Digital Spy caught up with Andre, who said: "I tweeted James today because I don't take it personally at all. You know it's down to the judges and to the public, it's not down to any individuals."I want him to know that I'm trying my best. I don't take it personally at all and I love James. He knows how much I respect Ola as well. I just think he was probably more upset that Ola's not in," he added. © BBC / Ray Burmiston/Matt Burlem The star was puzzled at why some people think he's receiving special treatment on Strictly Come Dancing, saying: "I can tell you now I didn't get the highest score on Saturday night. "The judges told me I'd made quite a few mistakes so I hope that they just said what they thought. I was last [to perform] the first week, I was second last this week, I may be in the middle next week. I don't know."Andre also exclusively told us that he'll transform into Pirates of the Caribbean's Jack Sparrow on Saturday for Movie Week.In the meantime, the star is also preparing to release a new Rat Pack-inspired album Come Fly with Me on October 16.
